CatDescriptText: Joseph Fitts, 2120 Bedford Avenue was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 13, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the hospital service rendered under Blue Cross plan is worth its present cost to the subscriber? Do you think the rates should be raised?  Why?"  answer reads: "I really don't know, but I think that the Blue Cross program is a good one, especially for persons who have families.  It is a good safeguard for emergencies.  I don't know about the rate increase, but I might say that in past they have gone up because the hospital treatment has improved tremendously."
TitMainTitle: Man on left, possibly George Barbour, wearing eyeglasses and holding a small dark notebook, talking to Joseph Fitts wearing dark zippered jacket with collar, straw hat with dark striped band, and moustache, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
